doc.previous: In some contexts, parametric equations involving only rational functions (that is fractions of two polynomials) are preferred, if they exist. In the case of the circle, such a rational parameterization is
doc.after: With this parametric equation, the point (-1, 0) is not represented by a real value of t, but by the limit of x and y when t tends to infinity.
